Debrief: Make is an online automation platform that empowers users to visually connect apps, services, and devices to automate workflows using a no-code builder, recently expanding into AI-powered agents.
CompanySize_Employees: Estimated 565 employees as of June 2025, with other sources reporting ranges from over 300 to 826 employees in recent years.

CoreOffering_Summary: Make provides a visual-first, no-code integration and automation development platform that enables businesses to connect applications, visualize systems, streamline processes, and leverage AI for workflow automation.
KeyFeatures_AI_Automation: Integrations with over 200 AI apps (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, Google Vertex AI).
Recently launched 'Make AI Agents' for real-time intelligent automation that adapts dynamically, now available on all paid plans. [9]
AI Agents can understand goals in natural language, make decisions, and support various LLMs including OpenAI-compatible models. [7], [9], [11]
AI-powered automation that thinks and acts in the moment.
Make AI Tools available in Open Beta. [18]
Ongoing integration of latest AI models like OpenAI and Gemini. [18]
KeyFeatures_NoCode: Intuitive drag-and-drop interface for scenario creation.
Extensive library of pre-built templates for quick setup.
Automation_Scope: Automates repetitive tasks, data entry, notifications, and complex multi-step processes across various applications. Supports real-time processing and scheduled tasks.
Underlying_Technology: Hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Platform with a scalable architecture designed for performance and stability.
Integration_Capabilities: Connects with over 2,000+ pre-built apps and services. Offers robust API integration capabilities for connecting to virtually any web service with an API.
Customization_Level: Highly customizable with conditional logic, data transformations, and scheduled tasks. Allows for building complex, tailored automations and custom apps.
TargetAudience_Primary: Individuals, freelancers, solopreneurs, small to medium-sized business (SMB) teams, and large enterprises across various industries (IT, Operations, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Customer Experience).
TargetAudience_PersonasMatch_Seido: Make is a strong match for all Seido personas. Its no-code visual builder and extensive automation capabilities cater to consultants looking to scale, e-commerce innovators automating operations, visionary entrepreneurs validating ideas, and corporate insiders building tailored solutions.
ValueProposition_USP: Empowers users to visually orchestrate automation, designing, building, and automating tasks, workflows, apps, and systems with a flexible and scalable platform. Focuses on realizing the full potential of AI by integrating it into automation processes.
Positioning_Statement: The leading integration and automation development platform which empowers businesses across all verticals to visualize systems, streamline processes and put AI to work - and ultimately realize their full potential.
MarketSegment_Focus: Workflow automation, business process automation, application integration, and AI automation, serving a broad market from SMBs to enterprises.
BusinessModel: Subscription-based SaaS with tiered plans (Free, Core, Pro, Teams, Enterprise) based on the number of 'operations' (actions executed by modules).
Pricing_Tiers_Summary: Offers a Free plan (1,000 ops/month), Core ($9/month for 10,000 ops), Pro ($16/month for 10,000 ops), and Teams ($29/month for 10,000 ops), all billed annually. An Enterprise plan is available with custom pricing for advanced features and support.
MarketShare_Estimate: Considered a leader in customer satisfaction on major review platforms. Trusted by over 500,000 organizations globally. [5], [15]
Funding_Total_USD: N/A (Make, formerly Integromat, was acquired by Celonis in 2020 and operates as an operating subsidiary. It has not raised direct funding rounds as a standalone entity since the acquisition).
Recent_News_KeyDevelopments: May 30, 2025: Integrated latest AI models for OpenAI and Gemini, UI updates to module rename panel. [18]
May 20, 2025: Make AI Tools became available in Open Beta. [18]
May 7, 2025: Introduced Make Bridge, a faster way to bring integrations into products. [3]
May 5, 2025: Customer support access moved to paid subscriptions. [13]
May 2, 2025: Introduced Operations per Team Management (Enterprise feature), OAuth 2.0 protocol support, and improved notes experience. [10]
April 17, 2025: Announced affiliate payouts, incomplete execution retries, and new apps. [18]
April 14, 2025: Launched Make AI Agents (now available on all paid plans), adding real-time intelligence to no-code automation. [3], [6], [7], [9], [11]
April 3, 2025: Discontinued X (formerly Twitter) app integration due to API policy changes. [18], [22]
February 22, 2022: Integromat evolved and rebranded to Make.
Reported_Strengths: Visual, intuitive drag-and-drop interface for building workflows.
Extensive integrations with over 2,000 apps and services.
Powerful and flexible, capable of building complex and highly customized automations.
Generally considered cost-effective compared to major competitors like Zapier.
Scalable to support individuals, SMBs, and large enterprises.
Strong API integration capabilities for connecting to almost any web service.
Active investment and integration of AI capabilities, including new AI Agents.
Reported_Weaknesses: Can be complex for truly non-technical users, especially for advanced scenarios requiring understanding of data structures or programming principles.
Error messages can sometimes be uninformative, making troubleshooting difficult.
Pricing based on 'operations' can be confusing, with 'hidden charges' or unexpected consumption from polling/trigger checks.
Logging and search functionality for execution history could be improved.
Inconsistent or less responsive general customer support, with dedicated support for Enterprise plans. [12], [13]
Discontinuation of X (formerly Twitter) app integration due to API policy changes. [22]
Marketing_Channels_Primary: Official website and blog (guides, success stories, templates).
Sales_Approach: Primarily self-service for lower-tier plans, with a 'Talk to sales' option for Enterprise-level solutions and custom needs.
Geographic_Presence: Global presence, serving customers in over 170 countries. Has offices in Prague (HQ), other European locations, Asia, and the US (New York).
Review_CommonThemes_Positive: Ease of use and intuitive visual interface.
Powerful and flexible for complex automation needs.
Review_CommonThemes_Negative: Steep learning curve for non-technical users when building advanced automations.
Lack of detailed information in some error messages.
Complexity in understanding and managing 'operations' consumption, leading to unexpected costs.
Desire for improved logging and search features within scenario history.
Inconsistent or less responsive general customer support, with dedicated support for Enterprise plans. [12], [13]
Discontinuation of X (formerly Twitter) app integration. [22]
Relevance_To_NonTechnicalFounders: Highly relevant. Make's visual, no-code platform is designed to be accessible to non-technical users for automating business processes. While advanced use may require some technical aptitude, it significantly lowers the barrier to entry for automation.
AI_As_Technical_Cofounder_Analogy: Make is actively moving towards integrating AI into workflows and recently launched 'AI Agents' that can make decisions and adapt. This aligns with the 'technical cofounder' concept by handling complex automation logic. However, Seido's analogy focuses on building an entire AI-powered business value chain, which is a broader scope than Make's current AI agent capabilities.
Agent_Reusability_Platform_NetworkEffect: Make's newly introduced AI Agents are designed to be reusable across multiple workflows, promoting efficiency. The platform also supports sharing scenario templates, fostering a degree of reusability and potential network effects within teams and the broader community.
EaseOfUse_For_SeidoPersonas: Generally High. The visual drag-and-drop interface makes it intuitive for Seido's personas to get started with automation. However, for truly complex, system-level automations or deep customization, non-technical founders might encounter a steeper learning curve compared to Seido's promise of abstracting all technical complexity.
Seido_Differentiation_Points: Multi-Agent System (MAS) Focus: Seido enables the creation of an entire ecosystem of collaborating AI agents representing a full business value chain, a more holistic system-level approach compared to Make's workflow-centric AI Agents.

No-Code Orchestration: While both are no-code, Seido specifically abstracts the complexities of AI and automation for sophisticated agent workflows, allowing users to focus purely on business ideas without needing to understand underlying data structures or API intricacies.

Idea Validation First: Seido offers a free 'Automation Assessment' and idea validation tool *before* users commit to building, providing upfront value and reducing risk, a feature not explicitly offered by Make.

Agent Reusability & Marketplace: Seido aims to facilitate a dedicated marketplace for pre-built and custom agents, fostering stronger network effects and easier discovery/reuse than Make's current template sharing.

AI as a Technical Cofounder: Seido's core analogy positions AI as handling the entire complex technical backend for building a business, allowing the founder to be the visionary, a more comprehensive partnership model than Make's tool-based AI integration.
Opportunity_For_Seido: Emphasize a more comprehensive, system-level Multi-Agent System (MAS) approach that automates the entire business value chain, going beyond individual workflow optimization.
Highlight true no-code for complex AI orchestration, addressing Make's reported complexity for advanced non-technical users.
Leverage the unique free 'Automation Assessment' as a strong lead-generation and value-proposition tool, capturing users earlier in their entrepreneurial journey.

Reinforce the 'AI as a Technical Cofounder' narrative, positioning Seido as the partner that builds the entire AI-powered business, offering a deeper level of support and abstraction than a general automation tool.
Notes_QualitativeInsights: Make is a mature and powerful iPaaS with a strong visual interface and a large user base. Its recent strategic move into AI Agents positions it as a significant player in the evolving AI automation market. While it offers extensive capabilities, its 'operations'-based pricing model and potential complexity for truly non-technical users in advanced scenarios present opportunities for Seido to differentiate with a simpler, more holistic 'AI co-founder' approach for building entire businesses.
